Landmannalaugar.name: Landmannalaugar
Landmannalaugar.description: Stunning highland destination famous for colorful rhyolite mountains, natural hot springs, and dramatic landscapes.

alternatives.name: Kerlingarfjöll
alternatives.description: Dramatic highland area with geothermal activity, colorful mountains, and excellent hiking trails.

alternatives.name: Þórsmörk (Thorsmork)
alternatives.description: Valley surrounded by glaciers and mountains, accessible by super jeep with diverse hiking trails.

local_insights: Book parking online as soon as reservations open
The hot spring gets very crowded - visit early or late
Bring waterproof hiking boots for the trails

Dettifoss.name: Dettifoss
Dettifoss.description: Europe's most powerful waterfall by volume, with 500 cubic meters of water per second thundering over 45m cliff.
tips: Accessible from both east and west sides
West side (862) has better views but rougher road
Extremely loud - you'll feel the power

alternatives.name: Selfoss
alternatives.description: Horseshoe-shaped waterfall just upstream from Dettifoss, less crowded with unique curved formation.

alternatives.name: Goðafoss
alternatives.description: The 'Waterfall of the Gods' with historical significance and horseshoe shape, easily accessible from Ring Road.

local_insights: East side (864) is easier drive but further walk
West side gets better afternoon light
Bring windproof clothing - it's incredibly windy

Kirkjufellsfoss.name: Kirkjufellsfoss
Kirkjufellsfoss.description: Picturesque waterfall with iconic Kirkjufell mountain backdrop - one of the most photographed locations in Iceland.

alternatives.name: Vestrahorn (Stokksnes)
alternatives.description: Dramatic Batman-shaped mountain with black sand dunes and Vikings village film set.

alternatives.name: Búðir Church & Snæfellsjökull
alternatives.description: Iconic black church with glacier-capped Snæfellsjökull volcano backdrop on Snæfellsnes Peninsula.

local_insights: The classic tripod spots are always occupied during peak hours
Early morning (5-7 AM) is best for photography
Northern Lights season is September to March

Ásbyrgi Canyon.name: Ásbyrgi Canyon
Ásbyrgi Canyon.description: Horseshoe-shaped canyon formed by glacial flooding, creating a sheltered oasis with unique ecosystem.
tips: Several hiking trails of varying difficulty
Nordic mythology connects it to Odin's horse

alternatives.name: Fjaðrárgljúfur Canyon
alternatives.description: Dramatic serpentine canyon with winding river, famous for its appearance in Justin Bieber music video.
cons: Very crowded since Justin Bieber video
Can be closed to protect vegetation

alternatives.name: Kolugljúfur Canyon
alternatives.description: Hidden canyon with multiple waterfalls and viewing platforms, off the beaten path treasure.

local_insights: The legend says it's a hoofprint from Odin's eight-legged horse Sleipnir
Best viewpoint is from the cliff rim trail
Surprisingly sheltered climate supports birch trees

Hvítserkur.name: Hvítserkur
Hvítserkur.description: 15-meter tall basalt rock formation rising from the sea, resembling a drinking elephant or dragon.
tips: Seals often spotted in the area
pros: Free to visit with easy access

alternatives.name: Lóndrangar Cliffs
alternatives.description: Twin basalt pillars on Snæfellsnes Peninsula with dramatic coastal setting and birdlife.

alternatives.name: Dyrhólaey Arch
alternatives.description: Massive natural arch on the South Coast with black sand beaches and puffin viewing.
cons: Can be closed during nesting season

local_insights: The name means 'white shirt' due to bird droppings
Legend says it's a troll that was caught by sunrise
Best seal spotting is during low tide
